t: In middle of the path of our life
I came to my senses of so dark a forest
Surely the direct way was lost
Ah how to tell that was is this hard thing
this forest savage, bitter and harsh
that in every thought renews the fear!
So much is bitter, the little is more death
But for trait to good that I found
I'll say that the rest that I've supplies
I cannot well recount how I entered the wood
so full of sleep at that point
that the true way was abandoned
but then at the foot of the hill arrived
back to where end that valley
that my heart to fear to contrite
place to have ended the reasoning
high doctor, and attentive
in my view if I seemed content
and I, who has new thrist
to and within
in my view if I seemed content
